title: Which piece of music did Mozart write from memory after hearing it only twice? - Quora

response.answer_text: The piece of Renaissance Choral Music you are asking about is the ALLLEGRI MISERERE. It is a 12 mins 30 second piece of religious polyphony, sung in Latin, and is one of my favourite pieces of music, My CD recording is by The Tallis Scholars on the Gimmel label (1980). When I purchased my Yamaha Hi Fi system in December 2010 the salesman played this to me. and I told him “I know what this is”. It was his favourite too. When Mozart wrote it down, it had never been published.

It was the Allegri Miserere. Until Mozart did this the work was reserved solely for singing in the Sistine Chapel, where Mozart heard it. It was not freely available in writing to the public. Afterwards these were plainly impossible regulations, and they were withdrawn.
